meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

I'm thrilled to be reviewing the iconic Blizzard Entertainment game, Diablo. I mean, who doesn't love a good hack-and-slash RPG with dark fantasy vibes? It's like my favorite genre of music - heavy metal - but instead of screaming guitars and pounding drums, you get demonic hordes and ancient curses.

Now, let's talk about what all the other critics (ahem, Gamezilla!, Game Revolution, Adrenaline Vault, GameSpot, PC Gamer, Electric Playground, All Game Guide) are saying. I mean, these folks are like my gaming buddies, except instead of trash-talking at LAN parties, they're typing away on their keyboards, spewing out glowing reviews.

For instance, Gamezilla! says Diablo is the "best game I've seen in years." High praise, indeed! Game Revolution adds that it's a "high level of excellence" with "hundreds of beautifully rendered monstrosities, items and labyrinths." Okay, okay, I get it - this game is pretty awesome!

Adrenaline Vault takes it up a notch, calling Diablo "about as close to Hell as you're going to get... whether you believe in it or not." Whoa, talk about setting the bar high! And GameSpot chimes in with its own glowing review: "The best game to come out in the past year, and you should own a copy. Period."

Now, I know what you're thinking - what's the catch? Is Diablo perfect? Well, PC Gamer notes that RPG fans will be satisfied, but it doesn't hold too much charm after hours of playtime (thanks for the honesty, guys!). Electric Playground echoes this sentiment, saying the action can become repetitive. And All Game Guide has some minor gripes about the game's lack of complexity.

But let's be real, folks - Diablo is still an incredible game that holds up even today. Its engaging gameplay, dark atmosphere, and addictive multiplayer features make it a must-play for any RPG fan. So, what are you waiting for? Dive into the world of Sanctuary, grab your trusty sword (or spellbook), and get ready to battle those demons!

Stay groovy,
